definition: to tower/to stand straight (of person's bearing)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb

sentences.english: Farther east stand the Velvet Hills, whence we are bound.
sentences.chinese: 再远的东边屹立着天鹅绒山脉，那里是我们的边界了。

sentences.english: The arch stands silent revealed a Shanfucun ancient cultural atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 屹立的牌坊无声的透露着山甫村久远的人文气息。

sentences.english: The statues of former navy generals stand rock-firm, silently observing Weihai's tremendous changes.
sentences.chinese: 海军将领的雕像昂然屹立，静观着威海的沧桑巨变。

sentences.english: It rose as a monument to human ingenuity immovably firm.
sentences.chinese: 它有如人类智慧的丰碑，巍然屹立，岿然不动。

sentences.english: Stand tall red political power in the land, confrontation with the kuomintang regime.
sentences.chinese: 红色政权巍然屹立在中华大地上，同国民党政权对峙。

sentences.english: Student should fully lengthen their spine and stand tall.
sentences.chinese: 学生应充分延长他们的脊柱和巍然屹立。

sentences.english: Harvest, though, stands as the coming-of-age of the Baby Boomer generation.
sentences.chinese: 尽管《收获》将屹立于成年的“生育高峰期一代”。

sentences.english: Spain’s name will be on the top of the world for the next four years.
sentences.chinese: 在今后的四年中，西班牙的名字将屹立在世界之巅。

sentences.english: This railway station remains standing despite having experienced numerous earthquakes.
sentences.chinese: 这座火车站虽然历经多次地震，却仍屹立不摇。

sentences.english: You raise me up, so I can stand on mountains.
sentences.chinese: 你给了我依靠，我才能屹立于群山之巅。

sentences.english: To make the Chinese Nation stand towering in world nation community, education shall be grasped well primarily.
sentences.chinese: 要使中华民族屹立于世界民族之林，首先应抓好教育。

sentences.english: The lofty pagoda stands like a giant at the top of the mountain.
You will always be standing among the peoples of the world.
sentences.chinese: 您将永远屹立于世界民族之林。

sentences.english: This building holds up well despite its age.
sentences.chinese: 尽管年代久远，这座建筑物仍巍然屹立。

sentences.english: These are the Amish, an enduring and endearing people.
sentences.chinese: 这些就是业米希人，一个屹立不动令人喜爱的民族。

sentences.english: The church Stands majestically on the top of the Montmatre hill.
sentences.chinese: 这座宏伟的教堂巍然屹立在蒙马特高地的顶端。

definition: to stand tall and rock-solid (idiom)/towering majestically/(of a person) to stand up against sb
to tower/standing tall and upright (of large building)
to stand for a long time
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
to be perched high/to be located prominently/to be preeminent
to be situated/to be located (of a building)
to be situated/located at (of building)/also written 坐落[zuo4 luo4]
